sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: This document tests the DocBook transformations in &yelp;. Each section in this document tests a particular element or group of elements from DocBook.

sect1.title: Admonitions
sect1.para: This sections tests the admonition elements in DocBook. Here is a caution:

caution.title: Look Out!
caution.para: If you don't understand the difference between caution and warning, you will die. Since no mortal understands the difference, it stands to reason that all mortals will die. QED.

sect1.para: Here we have an important and a note right next to each other. This is a nice thing to test, but it should generally be considered bad style.

important.title: This Is Important.
important.para: Here is a really important piece of information. Do not forget this information, or you'll be in really bad shape.

note.title: That Was Important.
note.para: Please note that the previous piece of self-referential information, though seemingly meaningless, was extremely important, just as it claimed to be.

tip.para: If your meal costs $11.20, you should tip $2.24, or 20%. Of course, you should not feal obliged to give a full 20% tip if your service wasn't up to par.

sect1.para:
And finally, we'll have a warning. Just to mix things up a bit, we'll put this one inside the paragraph.
DocBook Is a Beast
Before you start doing stuff like this, you should be warned that DocBook is a beast. It's very difficult to wrap your head around all of the elements.
Note that we are still inside of the same paragraph as above. After this sentence, however, we will not be.

sect1.title: Class Synopses
sect1.para: This section tests the classsynopsis element. The formatting of classsynopis is controlled entirely by the language attribute, which specifies the programming language being presented.
